abstracts.cdata!:
Project outcomes were satisfactory, and
            sustainability likely, though institutional development
            impacts only modest. Lessons first point at the need for
            detailed designs, and tender documents to be ready at loan
            effectiveness, so as not to delay construction works,
            regardless of a perceived urgency to present the project to
            the Board prior to the completeness of its preparation. This
            in fact caused not only construction delays, but distracted
            attention to implementation as a result of insufficient
            preparation. Likewise, technical feasibility of local
            contractors should be assessed, exemplified in this case by
            the absence of local technology for protecting dikes during
            construction. Fortunately, reliable consultants were able to
            implement contractual incentives, an effective option to
            prod implementation, and management. The long lending
            suspension to Iran, calls for a financial management plan,
            to be partly expressed in a detailed implementation manual,
            and thus, circumvent the lack of experience with Bank
            procedures, procurement, and disbursement. Finally, linking
            Bank disbursements in the local currency - an exchange rate
            with little relevance to that of the Tehran stock exchange -
            produced negative results; rather, disbursements should have
            been linked to the Tehran stock exchange.
